reviewText:
Still a better story than the current TWD Season (TV Show)!

Just kidding, Zombie Killtime has no story but it does not need it, either!

Choose your character (you can alter his appearance), select one of many stages and even better, grab a friend or two and get going!
Earn money and use it wisely because this game appears relaxing and easy the first waves but kicks your ♥♥♥ later on if you do not pay attention.
Graphics are ok, a little too simple for me but no buzzkill.
Multiplayer is online but I did not try it yet.

6,99 may be a little too much but since this feels better than the latest CODs, screw COD and get this little gem!

Bottom line: Relaxing the first 10-20 waves but testing your patience and skill for 100 waves.

Only potential NEGATIVE point so far: as soon as you land on a group of zombies, your lifebar shrinks faster than everyones symapthie for Jack and Jill because you can not jump right away.


Otherwise, recommended!
voteText: 9 of 14 people (64%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Zombie Killtime is a very basic blockish game in which you kill zombies (as the title suggests).
Nothing too amazing, just kill the zombies before they kill you. The usual stuff.

Unfortunately, you are unable to save games; so, if you get to level 99, make a mistake and die, then you have to start all over again from level 1. Not impressive; that sort of thing is just a massive time-waster as far as I am concerned.

The nine achievements are all set for long play time.
* Make it to wave 100
* Kill a total of 10000 zombies
* Earn 1000000 dollars
* Spend 1000000 dollars
* Get 10000 headshots
* Get 10000 longshots
* Get 10000 one shot kills
* Kill a total of 1000 bosses
* Get 10000 melee kills
At this date, your Steam achievements list doesn't show your cumulative totals.

It's obvious from the outset that this is not an advanced and amazing game; so, it's a shame that Steam only has a Yes" or "No" choice as to whether you recommend this game - there needs to be at least a third option
date: one which says something like "It's ok for what it is".\n\nThat's how I would rate Zombie Killtime
recommended: it's ok for what it is. You can see that it's a very basic game
hoursPlayed: so you should expect nothing more.\nHowever
votesHelpful:
I have to give this game a thumbs down.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UPDATE:
I have moved the following section to the bottom of the review
votesTotal: as it is no longer applicable; however
votesFunny: I haven't deleted it from the review altogether as it shows that the developer of this game pays attention to comments and responds
commentsCount: which should be commended.\n\nThe game gives you the option to change the keyboard settings
column16: but it actually wouldn't accept the arrow keys instead of the WASD keys - so I wasn't impressed with that.\n[UPDATE: This situation has changed
column17: the arrow keys will now work when altered in the settings. Well done to the developer!!]"

reviewText: This game in its current form is unplayable.\nI bought two copies so I could play with a friend. The game looked reasonably fun. The first sign of a broken game was when it crashed twice before I could get in. When I finally got into my friend's game zombies spawned, but none of them moved and you couldnt kill them. We sat there confused for about three minutes, waiting for something to happen and got no result. We restarted the game and it worked, but the connection kept breaking between us.\nDon't buy this game
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
5/10 - So bad it's good..

For how ♥♥♥♥♥♥ the graphic are this game is actually really fun. This game comes in waves, each wave harder. The mechanics aren't bad and there are a plethora of maps to play.

Multiplayer had no servers or online players. You can host a game but goodluck. This would be fun with an active community or BYOF.(Bring your own friends.)

Not worth $6,99 - But for $2 or less it would be worth the look.
